the-expectations.title: The Expectations of a Senior Frontend Engineer - Skills and Responsibilities
content: Checkout.com, is an international financial technology company which processes payments for other companies. Founded as Opus Payments in 2009, it is headquartered in London, United Kingdom. It had a valuation of $40 billion USD in 2022, making it the most valuable European fintech startup.

Technical engineers must possess deep knowledge of frontend tooling, performance optimization, state management, and CI/CD workflows. Familiarity with system design and cross-functional collaboration is crucial.
Senior engineers are expected to lead projects, mentor junior developers, and ensure architectural soundness across the frontend stack.

mastering-css-grid.title: Mastering CSS Grid Layout: A Complete Guide
content: CSS Grid is a powerful layout system available in CSS. It's a 2-dimensional system, meaning it can handle both columns and rows.
Key concepts include grid containers, grid items, tracks, and placement properties like `grid-template-columns` and `grid-area`.
For instance, building a dashboard or magazine-style layout is much simpler with Grid than with Flexbox. It allows precise control over alignment and spacing.

getting-started-nodejs.title: Getting Started with Node.js for Backend Development
content: Node.js is an asynchronous, event-driven JavaScript runtime designed to build scalable network applications. It's lightweight and efficient.
Start by installing Node.js and using npm or yarn for package management. A typical project begins with `npm init`.
You can create a simple API using Express.js. Define endpoints, handle requests, and return responses all within minutes.

seo-in-modern-web.title: SEO in Modern Web Development
content: Search Engine Optimization (SEO) ensures your site is discoverable by search engines and ranks high in relevant searches.
Use semantic HTML, meaningful meta tags, keyword-rich headings, and fast-loading content to boost SEO.
Ensure your site has clean URLs, proper canonical tags, robots.txt, sitemaps, and mobile responsiveness for good SEO health.

deploy-nextjs-vercel.title: How to Deploy a Next.js App on Vercel
content: Make sure your Next.js project is production-ready, optimized with `next build` and has all environment variables set.
Create a free Vercel account and link your GitHub repo. Vercel automatically detects Next.js and configures build steps.
Once deployed, you can manage previews, rollbacks, and monitor performance analytics directly from the Vercel dashboard.
